doc.after: Turkic peoples practiced a variety of shamanism before adopting Islam. Abbasid influence in Central Asia was ensured through a process that was greatly facilitated by the Muslim conquest of Transoxiana. Many of the various Turkic tribesâincluding the Oghuz Turks, who were the ancestors of both the Seljuks and the Ottomansâgradually converted to Islam, and brought the religion with them to Anatolia beginning in the 11th century.
